تم إرسال هذا البريد الإلكتروني من خارج مجموعة شلهوب. لا تنقر على الروابط أو تفتح المرفقات إلا إذا كنت تعرف المرسل وتعلم أنه آمن

Dear Hagop and Nino

 

Since we migrate to a new system last year, the team had to dig into the old system/files, and they managed to get the attached invoices. Hope this will be fine for the insurance company as this is all what we have…

 

Concerning the Police Report and as I confirmed many times before, we applied twice online to get the report and the footage with no success. The only element we have is the below reference that was given to the team at the date of the rubbery. The CCTV footage is stored in our security system for 2 weeks only (so no more data in our system), but the images were given to the police on a USB key 2 days after the event.

What I understood from Pierre Antoine that the insurance company should contact the Police Dept to get that information.

 

Hagop, this is all what we can provide from this old event. I hope that the insurance company can help to get the insured amount so we can close this file at the earliest.

Dear Nino,

 

Please find below the requested details:

 

*	Incident Report:

	*	On Saturday, October 21st, at approximately 5AM local time, the Christofle Montreal Boutique manager (Catherine Leduc) was woken up by multiple calls from the local police department.

Police was on site at our 2025 Rue de la Montagne boutique, as they had been alerted by the boutique alarm that was triggered by a robbery that had just happened.

Ms Leduc arrived on site shortly after, to see the street facing door of the boutique broken in, and many items in the displays missing. The burglars did not damage the furniture or anything else but the door. They broke in, took jewelry and silver objects and left within a few minutes. 

The police asked Ms Leduc several questions, which she answered, and then provided her with the case number. The police report is not made available to us. I assume the insurance company may contact the police with the report number we provided to access the full report.

*	As for the quantum of the storage, it will be as declared within the policy with no change in insured value.
*	As of now, no stolen good have been recovered, will advise if this changes.

Dear Hagop,

 

Good afternoon.

 

The insurance company is requesting for the below for their review:

 

*	Detailed Incident report 
*	Copy of Police report (as the attached one is only a reference number )
*	As per the policy conditions “Declaration of quantum in storage for each of the locations separately on monthly basis”  .Please confirm whether this was declared and let us have the copy of declaration to UW 
*	Please advise us if any of the stolen goods were later recovered. If so, do provide us a copy.
*	Inventory register /log that supporting the duration of storage at the loss location  (Please note that policy condition that Maximum period in store : 1 Year at any of the premises)

Additional documents, if required necessary to assess the loss , shall be requested in due course.

 

 

Thank you and best regards,

 

Nino Bacalso

Subject: Christofle Montreal boutique break-in Saturday Oct 21

 

This message is from an external sender - be cautious, particularly with links and attachments. 
رسالة من مرسل خارجي - كن حذرًا مع الروابط والمرفقات

Dear Hagop,

 

The Christofle boutique in Montreal was broken in on Oct 21st around 4AM local time.

 

*	Police was on site and shared the police report number with us
*	Product was stolen: see below and attached the detail
*	Outside door was damaged (repair was done, invoice not received yet

Please find attached the detail of all the goods stolen today. The worth value is $30630.

 

The door is sealed and fixed now so we are back to normal business.

 

 

Thank you and have a wonderful weekend,

 

Catherine LEDUC

Concerning the Police Report and as I confirmed many times before, we applied twice online to get the report and the footage with no success. The only element we have is the below reference that was given to the team at the date of the rubbery. The CCTV footage is stored in our security system for 2 weeks only (so no more data in our system), but the images were given to the police on a USB key 2 days after the event.

What I understood from Pierre Antoine that the insurance company should contact the Police Dept to get that information.

 

Hagop, this is all what we can provide from this old event. I hope that the insurance company can help to get the insured amount so we can close this file at the earliest.

Youssef

Dear Hagop,

 

Please see below comments from the insurance company:

 

QUOTE

 

Thank you for your email. The below details are still awaited and request you to do the needful to arrange the same .

 

*	Copy of Police report (as the attached one is only a reference number ) .Please advise the assured to arrange the same. 
*	As per the policy conditions “Declaration of quantum in storage for each of the locations separately on monthly basis”  .Please confirm whether this was declared and let us have the copy of declaration to UW.
*	Inventory register /log that supporting the duration of storage at the loss location  (Please note that policy condition that Maximum period in store : 1 Year at any of the premises)

 

Upon receipt of the above, we shall further review and revert to you appropriately .

Additional documents, if required necessary to assess the loss required by us, shall be requested on due course. Our advice at this stage is on without prejudice basis and without admission of liability and the claim shall be dealt as per policy terms and conditions.

 

UNQUOTE

 

Thank you and best regards,

 

Nino Bacalso

Dear Nino,

 

Please find below the requested details:

 

*	Incident Report:

	*	On Saturday, October 21st, at approximately 5AM local time, the Christofle Montreal Boutique manager (Catherine Leduc) was woken up by multiple calls from the local police department.

Police was on site at our 2025 Rue de la Montagne boutique, as they had been alerted by the boutique alarm that was triggered by a robbery that had just happened.

Ms Leduc arrived on site shortly after, to see the street facing door of the boutique broken in, and many items in the displays missing. The burglars did not damage the furniture or anything else but the door. They broke in, took jewelry and silver objects and left within a few minutes. 

The police asked Ms Leduc several questions, which she answered, and then provided her with the case number. The police report is not made available to us. I assume the insurance company may contact the police with the report number we provided to access the full report.

*	As for the quantum of the storage, it will be as declared within the policy with no change in insured value.
*	As of now, no stolen good have been recovered, will advise if this changes.

Dear Hagop,

 

Good afternoon.

 

The insurance company is requesting for the below for their review:

 

*	Detailed Incident report 
*	Copy of Police report (as the attached one is only a reference number )
*	As per the policy conditions “Declaration of quantum in storage for each of the locations separately on monthly basis”  .Please confirm whether this was declared and let us have the copy of declaration to UW 
*	Please advise us if any of the stolen goods were later recovered. If so, do provide us a copy.
*	Inventory register /log that supporting the duration of storage at the loss location  (Please note that policy condition that Maximum period in store : 1 Year at any of the premises)

Additional documents, if required necessary to assess the loss , shall be requested in due course.

 

 

Thank you and best regards,

 

Nino Bacalso

Concerning the Police Report and as I confirmed many times before, we applied twice online to get the report and the footage with no success. The only element we have is the below reference that was given to the team at the date of the rubbery. The CCTV footage is stored in our security system for 2 weeks only (so no more data in our system), but the images were given to the police on a USB key 2 days after the event.

What I understood from Pierre Antoine that the insurance company should contact the Police Dept to get that information.

 

Hagop, this is all what we can provide from this old event. I hope that the insurance company can help to get the insured amount so we can close this file at the earliest.

 

Best regards,

 

Youssef

*	Supplier’s invoices validating the amounts to be claimed (top 7 items of the 15 in terms of value should be enough for validating the claimed amounts)

*	Copy of the police report and any updates on the case.
*	Related CCTV footage, if available

 

Once we receive the above details, we can proceed further.

Hagop

Dear Nino,

 

Please find below the requested details:

 

*	Incident Report:

	*	On Saturday, October 21st, at approximately 5AM local time, the Christofle Montreal Boutique manager (Catherine Leduc) was woken up by multiple calls from the local police department.

Police was on site at our 2025 Rue de la Montagne boutique, as they had been alerted by the boutique alarm that was triggered by a robbery that had just happened.

Ms Leduc arrived on site shortly after, to see the street facing door of the boutique broken in, and many items in the displays missing. The burglars did not damage the furniture or anything else but the door. They broke in, took jewelry and silver objects and left within a few minutes. 

The police asked Ms Leduc several questions, which she answered, and then provided her with the case number. The police report is not made available to us. I assume the insurance company may contact the police with the report number we provided to access the full report.

*	As for the quantum of the storage, it will be as declared within the policy with no change in insured value.
*	As of now, no stolen good have been recovered, will advise if this changes.

Dear Hagop,

 

Good afternoon.

 

The insurance company is requesting for the below for their review:

 

*	Detailed Incident report 
*	Copy of Police report (as the attached one is only a reference number )
*	As per the policy conditions “Declaration of quantum in storage for each of the locations separately on monthly basis”  .Please confirm whether this was declared and let us have the copy of declaration to UW 
*	Please advise us if any of the stolen goods were later recovered. If so, do provide us a copy.
*	Inventory register /log that supporting the duration of storage at the loss location  (Please note that policy condition that Maximum period in store : 1 Year at any of the premises)

Additional documents, if required necessary to assess the loss , shall be requested in due course.

 

 

Thank you and best regards,

 

Nino Bacalso

chunks.text:
Concerning the Police Report and as I confirmed many times before, we applied twice online to get the report and the footage with no success. The only element we have is the below reference that was given to the team at the date of the rubbery. The CCTV footage is stored in our security system for 2 weeks only (so no more data in our system), but the images were given to the police on a USB key 2 days after the event.

What I understood from Pierre Antoine that the insurance company should contact the Police Dept to get that information.

 

Hagop, this is all what we can provide from this old event. I hope that the insurance company can help to get the insured amount so we can close this file at the earliest.

 

Best regards,

 

Youssef

Dear Youssef,

 

Hope all is well.

 

The below details are required for the claim:

 

*	Landed Cost price of stolen items
*	Supplier’s invoices validating the amounts to be claimed (top 7 items of the 15 in terms of value should be enough for validating the claimed amounts)

*	Date each product was shifted to the store, if available.
*	Copy of the police report and any updates on the case.
*	Related CCTV footage, if available

 

Once we receive the above details, we can proceed further.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

Dear Hagop,

 

Please see below comments from the insurance company:

 

QUOTE

 

Thank you for your email. The below details are still awaited and request you to do the needful to arrange the same .

 

*	Copy of Police report (as the attached one is only a reference number ) .Please advise the assured to arrange the same. 
*	As per the policy conditions “Declaration of quantum in storage for each of the locations separately on monthly basis”  .Please confirm whether this was declared and let us have the copy of declaration to UW.
*	Inventory register /log that supporting the duration of storage at the loss location  (Please note that policy condition that Maximum period in store : 1 Year at any of the premises)

 

Upon receipt of the above, we shall further review and revert to you appropriately .

Additional documents, if required necessary to assess the loss required by us, shall be requested on due course. Our advice at this stage is on without prejudice basis and without admission of liability and the claim shall be dealt as per policy terms and conditions.

!

EXTERNAL EMAIL
Do not click on links or attachments unless you recognize the sender and know that the content is safe.

 

Dear Nino,

 

Please find below the requested details:

 

*	Incident Report:

	*	On Saturday, October 21st, at approximately 5AM local time, the Christofle Montreal Boutique manager (Catherine Leduc) was woken up by multiple calls from the local police department.

Police was on site at our 2025 Rue de la Montagne boutique, as they had been alerted by the boutique alarm that was triggered by a robbery that had just happened.

Ms Leduc arrived on site shortly after, to see the street facing door of the boutique broken in, and many items in the displays missing. The burglars did not damage the furniture or anything else but the door. They broke in, took jewelry and silver objects and left within a few minutes. 

The police asked Ms Leduc several questions, which she answered, and then provided her with the case number. The police report is not made available to us. I assume the insurance company may contact the police with the report number we provided to access the full report.

*	As for the quantum of the storage, it will be as declared within the policy with no change in insured value.
*	As of now, no stolen good have been recovered, will advise if this changes.

Dear Hagop and Nino

 

Since we migrate to a new system last year, the team had to dig into the old system/files, and they managed to get the attached invoices. Hope this will be fine for the insurance company as this is all what we have…

 

Concerning the Police Report and as I confirmed many times before, we applied twice online to get the report and the footage with no success.

chunks.text:
Concerning the Police Report and as I confirmed many times before, we applied twice online to get the report and the footage with no success. The only element we have is the below reference that was given to the team at the date of the rubbery. The CCTV footage is stored in our security system for 2 weeks only (so no more data in our system), but the images were given to the police on a USB key 2 days after the event.

What I understood from Pierre Antoine that the insurance company should contact the Police Dept to get that information.

 

Hagop, this is all what we can provide from this old event. I hope that the insurance company can help to get the insured amount so we can close this file at the earliest.

 

Best regards,

 

Youssef

 



 

 

Youssef Khalat

Sr Manager Development & Operations

Dear Nino,

 

Please find below the requested details:

 

*	Incident Report:

	*	On Saturday, October 21st, at approximately 5AM local time, the Christofle Montreal Boutique manager (Catherine Leduc) was woken up by multiple calls from the local police department.

Police was on site at our 2025 Rue de la Montagne boutique, as they had been alerted by the boutique alarm that was triggered by a robbery that had just happened.

Ms Leduc arrived on site shortly after, to see the street facing door of the boutique broken in, and many items in the displays missing. The burglars did not damage the furniture or anything else but the door. They broke in, took jewelry and silver objects and left within a few minutes. 

The police asked Ms Leduc several questions, which she answered, and then provided her with the case number. The police report is not made available to us. I assume the insurance company may contact the police with the report number we provided to access the full report.

*	As for the quantum of the storage, it will be as declared within the policy with no change in insured value.
*	As of now, no stolen good have been recovered, will advise if this changes.

Dear Hagop,

 

The Christofle boutique in Montreal was broken in on Oct 21st around 4AM local time.

 

*	Police was on site and shared the police report number with us
*	Product was stolen: see below and attached the detail
*	Outside door was damaged (repair was done, invoice not received yet

 

Kindly let us know what next steps are and anything else needed.

 

Best

Concerning the Police Report and as I confirmed many times before, we applied twice online to get the report and the footage with no success. The only element we have is the below reference that was given to the team at the date of the rubbery. The CCTV footage is stored in our security system for 2 weeks only (so no more data in our system), but the images were given to the police on a USB key 2 days after the event.

What I understood from Pierre Antoine that the insurance company should contact the Police Dept to get that information.

 

Hagop, this is all what we can provide from this old event. I hope that the insurance company can help to get the insured amount so we can close this file at the earliest.

 

Best regards,

 

Youssef

Dear Youssef,

 

Hope all is well.

 

The below details are required for the claim:

 

*	Landed Cost price of stolen items
*	Supplier’s invoices validating the amounts to be claimed (top 7 items of the 15 in terms of value should be enough for validating the claimed amounts)

*	Date each product was shifted to the store, if available.
*	Copy of the police report and any updates on the case.
*	Related CCTV footage, if available

 

Once we receive the above details, we can proceed further.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

Dear Nino,

 

Please find below the requested details:

 

*	Incident Report:

	*	On Saturday, October 21st, at approximately 5AM local time, the Christofle Montreal Boutique manager (Catherine Leduc) was woken up by multiple calls from the local police department.

Police was on site at our 2025 Rue de la Montagne boutique, as they had been alerted by the boutique alarm that was triggered by a robbery that had just happened.

Ms Leduc arrived on site shortly after, to see the street facing door of the boutique broken in, and many items in the displays missing. The burglars did not damage the furniture or anything else but the door. They broke in, took jewelry and silver objects and left within a few minutes. 

The police asked Ms Leduc several questions, which she answered, and then provided her with the case number. The police report is not made available to us. I assume the insurance company may contact the police with the report number we provided to access the full report.

*	As for the quantum of the storage, it will be as declared within the policy with no change in insured value.
*	As of now, no stolen good have been recovered, will advise if this changes.

Dear Hagop,

 

Good afternoon.

 

The insurance company is requesting for the below for their review:

 

*	Detailed Incident report 
*	Copy of Police report (as the attached one is only a reference number )
*	As per the policy conditions “Declaration of quantum in storage for each of the locations separately on monthly basis”  .Please confirm whether this was declared and let us have the copy of declaration to UW 
*	Please advise us if any of the stolen goods were later recovered. If so, do provide us a copy.
*	Inventory register /log that supporting the duration of storage at the loss location  (Please note that policy condition that Maximum period in store : 1 Year at any of the premises)

Additional documents, if required necessary to assess the loss , shall be requested in due course.

 

 

Thank you and best regards,

Dear Nino,

 

We don’t have a company stamp,

 

In the U.S., company stamps (or seals) are not legally required for most official documents. Unlike some other countries where company chops are mandatory for contracts and legal paperwork, the U.S. primarily relies on signatures from authorized representatives.

However, some companies choose to use a corporate seal (embossed or ink stamp) as a form of formality, especially for:

*	Corporate resolutions
*	Stock certificates
*	Certain legal contracts

For most business transactions, a signed document is sufficient and legally binding without a company stamp.

 

Hope that clarifies.

 

Best regards,

 

Ellen Gu

Concerning the Police Report and as I confirmed many times before, we applied twice online to get the report and the footage with no success. The only element we have is the below reference that was given to the team at the date of the rubbery. The CCTV footage is stored in our security system for 2 weeks only (so no more data in our system), but the images were given to the police on a USB key 2 days after the event.

What I understood from Pierre Antoine that the insurance company should contact the Police Dept to get that information.

 

Hagop, this is all what we can provide from this old event. I hope that the insurance company can help to get the insured amount so we can close this file at the earliest.

!

EXTERNAL EMAIL
Do not click on links or attachments unless you recognize the sender and know that the content is safe.

 

Dear Nino,

 

Please find below the requested details:

 

*	Incident Report:

	*	On Saturday, October 21st, at approximately 5AM local time, the Christofle Montreal Boutique manager (Catherine Leduc) was woken up by multiple calls from the local police department.

Police was on site at our 2025 Rue de la Montagne boutique, as they had been alerted by the boutique alarm that was triggered by a robbery that had just happened.

Ms Leduc arrived on site shortly after, to see the street facing door of the boutique broken in, and many items in the displays missing. The burglars did not damage the furniture or anything else but the door. They broke in, took jewelry and silver objects and left within a few minutes. 

The police asked Ms Leduc several questions, which she answered, and then provided her with the case number. The police report is not made available to us. I assume the insurance company may contact the police with the report number we provided to access the full report.

*	As for the quantum of the storage, it will be as declared within the policy with no change in insured value.
*	As of now, no stolen good have been recovered, will advise if this changes.

Christofle Paris/ Christofle Montreal boutique break-in Saturday Oct 21, 2023 (STP Policy)/ Nasco Ref: 66-MCO-2023-10-000118 
 

Dear Nino,

 

We don’t have a company stamp,

 

In the U.S., company stamps (or seals) are not legally required for most official documents. Unlike some other countries where company chops are mandatory for contracts and legal paperwork, the U.S. primarily relies on signatures from authorized representatives.

However, some companies choose to use a corporate seal (embossed or ink stamp) as a form of formality, especially for:

*	Corporate resolutions
*	Stock certificates
*	Certain legal contracts

For most business transactions, a signed document is sufficient and legally binding without a company stamp.

 

Hope that clarifies.

 

Best regards,

 

Ellen Gu

Finance Director, Americas

 



 

 

41 Madison Avenue, 6th Floor

New York, NY 10010

 

Cell : +1 332.270.0750

chunks.text:
Concerning the Police Report and as I confirmed many times before, we applied twice online to get the report and the footage with no success. The only element we have is the below reference that was given to the team at the date of the rubbery. The CCTV footage is stored in our security system for 2 weeks only (so no more data in our system), but the images were given to the police on a USB key 2 days after the event.

What I understood from Pierre Antoine that the insurance company should contact the Police Dept to get that information.

 

Hagop, this is all what we can provide from this old event. I hope that the insurance company can help to get the insured amount so we can close this file at the earliest.

 

Best regards,

 

Youssef

EXTERNAL EMAIL
Do not click on links or attachments unless you recognize the sender and know that the content is safe.

 

Dear Nino,

 

Please find below the requested details:

 

*	Incident Report:

	*	On Saturday, October 21st, at approximately 5AM local time, the Christofle Montreal Boutique manager (Catherine Leduc) was woken up by multiple calls from the local police department.

Police was on site at our 2025 Rue de la Montagne boutique, as they had been alerted by the boutique alarm that was triggered by a robbery that had just happened.

Ms Leduc arrived on site shortly after, to see the street facing door of the boutique broken in, and many items in the displays missing. The burglars did not damage the furniture or anything else but the door. They broke in, took jewelry and silver objects and left within a few minutes. 

The police asked Ms Leduc several questions, which she answered, and then provided her with the case number. The police report is not made available to us. I assume the insurance company may contact the police with the report number we provided to access the full report.

*	As for the quantum of the storage, it will be as declared within the policy with no change in insured value.
*	As of now, no stolen good have been recovered, will advise if this changes.

Dear Nino,

 

We don’t have a company stamp,

 

In the U.S., company stamps (or seals) are not legally required for most official documents. Unlike some other countries where company chops are mandatory for contracts and legal paperwork, the U.S. primarily relies on signatures from authorized representatives.

However, some companies choose to use a corporate seal (embossed or ink stamp) as a form of formality, especially for:

*	Corporate resolutions
*	Stock certificates
*	Certain legal contracts

For most business transactions, a signed document is sufficient and legally binding without a company stamp.

 

Hope that clarifies.

 

Best regards,

 

Ellen Gu

Finance Director, Americas

New York, NY 10010

chunks.text:
Concerning the Police Report and as I confirmed many times before, we applied twice online to get the report and the footage with no success. The only element we have is the below reference that was given to the team at the date of the rubbery. The CCTV footage is stored in our security system for 2 weeks only (so no more data in our system), but the images were given to the police on a USB key 2 days after the event.

What I understood from Pierre Antoine that the insurance company should contact the Police Dept to get that information.

 

Hagop, this is all what we can provide from this old event. I hope that the insurance company can help to get the insured amount so we can close this file at the earliest.

 

Best regards,

 

Youssef

Dear Youssef,

 

Hope all is well.

 

The below details are required for the claim:

 

*	Landed Cost price of stolen items
*	Supplier’s invoices validating the amounts to be claimed (top 7 items of the 15 in terms of value should be enough for validating the claimed amounts)

*	Date each product was shifted to the store, if available.
*	Copy of the police report and any updates on the case.
*	Related CCTV footage, if available

 

Once we receive the above details, we can proceed further.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop
